It is possible to use a variety of smart phones      to access NYU resources, but ITS' support for smart phones is currently      limited to BlackBerry, Android, and iPhone. If you own a different brand, it      may be possible to use portions of these instructions to configure      your smart phone.          NYU Mobile is NYU's official app for iOS and Android devices, offering real-time      shuttle tracking, university events, campus map, contact information from the NYU      Directory, University news, and more. For additional information and instructions on downloading     the app, visit www.nyu.edu/mobile .                     ITS provides basic information for NYU faculty, staff, and administrators on requesting an NYU-purchased smart phone    (such as an iPhone, BlackBerry, or Android device) and mobile devices (such as the iPad and iPod Touch) and configuring it to    access NYU resources such as email, calendaring, NYURoam wireless access, and VPN.     Eligibility    Requesting a mobile device    Available models, billing and plans    ITS support for mobile devices       Step-by-Step Guides          Eligibility   Eligibility for an NYU-purchased smart phone or mobile device, and the policy for using the device, is determined by the head of your division. All requests for an NYU-purchased devices must be approved before the request is submitted to ITS.   Requesting a mobile device   To request a new smart phone, please download and fill out one of the carrier-specific forms below. ITS recommends recent models of iPhone, Android, or BlackBerry devices.       AT&T     Verizon       Once you have filled out one of the above forms, received departmental approval, and have all the necessary signatures, please scan and email the form to its.mobile@nyu.edu . Orders take five to seven business days to arrive. ITS will contact you when the phone is ready.    Billing and plan options   For an overview of billing and plan options, see the ServiceLink knowledge base: Mobile Devices (ITS): Billing and plans .    ITS support for mobile devices    ITS provides online and phone support for using your device with NYU enterprise technology services. If you are an NYU staff or faculty member, and your department has determined that you are eligible for an NYU-issued mobile device, ITS Mobile can help acquire and activate it for you. See the FAQs page for details about the services, devices, and support that ITS Mobile offers. If you are ready to request a device, you can download one of the device-specific forms (see the right-hand sidebar) and email a scan of the completed, signed form to its.mobile@nyu.edu .    If you are an NYU staff or faculty member, your department or program may participate in a service which provides for on-site and in-person smart phone support. Please visit the ITS Desktop Support page for more information.      Step-by-Step Guides   For instructions on activating and configuring your device to check and send NYU Email, synchronize with your desktop address book, browse the web, and more, see the Initial Setup tab .    Important Note : Because instructions change frequently and can vary from device to device and between  wireless carriers (AT&T, Verizon, etc.), it's important  that you rely on the product- and network-specific instructions that  come with your device and are given to you by the carrier you chose.  ITS' guides are intended only to provide basic information about using your  smart phone at NYU, and may not reflect the most recent information from your wireless carrier and/or device manufacturer.    Page last reviewed: October 25, 2013

These instructions will help you activate your BlackBerry or iPhone and connect to a variety of NYU services. Because instructions can vary from device to device and among wireless carriers, it's important that you rely on the product- and carrier-specific instructions that come with your phone.     While it is possible to use a variety of smart phones to access NYU resources, ITS' mobile support is currently limited. Below you will find instructions on how to configure your device to access the NYURoam wireless and NYU email accounts.   For instructions on how to configure and connect your mobile device to NYURoam visit http://www.nyu.edu/its/wireless/configure/ .   For instructions on configuring your NYU Gmail on your mobile device visit http://www.nyu.edu/its/askits/public/041216413245939 .   If you have a Law School Exchange account and wish to configure that on your mobile device, follow the below instructions.   For devices with mobile plans (mainly smartphones), be sure to have an appropriate data plan or you may incur large cell bills by exceeding your data plan. We strongly encourage an unlimited data plan.   Supported Platforms (including smartphones and tablet devices)     iOS   Android   Windows Phone   BlackBerry     iOS (iPhone/iPad)   Setup Instructions   iOS users should make sure to always update your device to the latest software.     From the Home Screen, select Settings > Mail, Contacts, Calendars > Add Account > Microsoft Exchange   Enter your e-mail address, password, and an optional description (Email can be your alias: first.last@nyu.edu or your full exchange account: username@exchange.law.nyu.edu )   Tap Next and the account will verify and prompt you for more information   Enter the server: exchange.law.nyu.edu, domain: lawnyu , and your username   Tap Next   Tap the sliders to turn Mail, Contacts, and Calendar sync on or off. Note: Your phone will prompt you if you want to save or delete any current contacts or calendar items on your phone if you enable Exchange sync for them   Tap Save and allow the phone a few minutes to sync   You may change sync options by tapping Settings > Mail, Contacts, Calendar and then select the account     Android   Setup Instructions     Press the Application Menu button and select Settings   Under Accounts, select Add account   Select Corporate and enter your email address and password   Press next and the phone should attempt to retrieve account information   Update the following information:    Domain\Username: lawnyu\ username   Server: exchange.law.nyu.edu       Press Next and select which items you want to sync (Mail, Contacts, and Calendar)   Press Finish     Windows Phone   Setup Instructions     Go to the Application List and select Settings > email+accounts   Select add an account > advanced setup   Enter your email address and password and press sign in   Select Exchange ActiveSync and update the following information:    User name   Domain: lawnyu   Server: exchange.law.nyu.edu       Select the Content to sync and press sign in     BlackBerry   Helpdesk needs to configure BlackBerry Enterprise Server (BES) on your BlackBerry for you. In order to synchronize your calendar and contact lists and 'push' your emails out faster to you, you need to first verify that you have the necessary level of service with your carrier. Contact Helpdesk to arrange an appointment for installation. Please plan accordingly as installation can take up to a few hours.
